intro: Asterolasia woombye var. intermedia, commonly known as the Woombye asterolasia, is a flowering plant native to Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, star-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. It is often found in open woodlands and heathlands, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
